Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RANATUERIN 2P (Ranatuerin-2P, natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; ZZHa_t; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: North American frog,Rana pipiens, orLithobates pipiens, ALSO: the Oregon spotted frogRana pretiosa

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  Disulfide bridge: C22,C27.Activity: Active against S. aureus (MIC 50 uM), E. coli (MIC 13 uM), and C. albicans (MIC 67 uM). This peptide could inhibit HIV infection at a concentration that is also toxic to T cells (J Virol 2005; 79:11598-11606).Sequence analysis: Found in multiple species.Updated 3/2015; 7/2021.
Literature Information.Author: Goraya J, Wang Y, Li Z, O'Flaherty M, Knoop FC, Platz JE, Conlon JM.2000
Literature Information.Title: Peptides with antimicrobial activity from four different families isolated from the skins of the North American frogs Rana luteiventris, Rana berlandieri and Rana pipiens.
